### Zell is a chatbot designed to improve the life of its users. It is a task manager based chatbot which help users keep track of their task. The best part of it is that it is **FREE**.
Prerequisite: Ensure you have Java 17 installed on your Computer
2. Open a terminal and `cd` into the folder the jar file is in.
4. Refer below for all the commands you can use. You just need to type the valid commands in the box and click send or press enter to execute it.

* Executes the user command using the command extracted and the user's input.

* @param command The command to be executed.
* @param taskList The {@link zell.task.TaskList} object which stores tasks.

public String executeCommand(String userInput, String command, TaskList taskList,
output = handleMarkOrUnMark(command, userInput, firstSpaceIndex, taskList, storage);
output = handleTaskCommands(userInput, command, firstSpaceIndex, taskList, storage);
output = handleDelete(userInput, command, firstSpaceIndex, taskList, storage);

* Updates all the tasks in local storage.

*

We have to store every task in the task list since if a task is removed we cannot just remove one
* line from the local storage file since there will be a gap. We have to shift all the task after the
* removed one which will incur O(n).

*

So storing all the task when a task is added or removed is still the same
* time complexity of O(n) but makes it easier to implement.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be stored in local storage.
* @throws ZellException if we encounter some issue when storing the tasks in the file.
public void updateTasks(List<String> tasks) throws ZellException {
